Description: Carlson originally filed suit against Fox News CEO Roger Ailes personally for retaliating against her for complaining about sexual harassment. Parent company Twenty-First Century Fox settled with her but did not disclosue the amount. The $20 million was widely reported in the media; for example at https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/09/fox-news-settles-with-gretchen-carlson-for-20-million

In May 2018 the New York Times revealed that Twenty-First Century Fox had agreed to resolve a group of racial and gender employment discrimination lawsuits, including the three cited here, for a total of $10 million (with no breakdown given).
Court: Southern District of New York (2); New York County Supreme Court
Private Litigation Case Title: Blanco v. Twenty-First Century Fox, Inc. et al; Ujkic v. Twenty-First Century Fox, Inc. et al; GOLLOHER, JESSICA vs. TWENTY-FIRST CENTURY FOX, INC.

Agency: New York City Commission on Human Rights
